definitions.definition: Originally, a border or edge of a sea , a river , or other body of water ; now, any border or edge.

subdefinitions.definition: The topmost lip or rim of a container , or a natural feature shaped like a container.
examples: The toy box was filled to the brim with stuffed animals.

subdefinitions.definition: A projecting rim. ( especially ) That of a hat .
examples: He turned the back of his brim up stylishly.

subdefinitions.definition: ( archaic or poetic ) The upper edge or surface of water .
( obsolete ) The surface of the ground . ( figurative ) A brink or edge.

main_definition: Originally, a border or edge of a sea , a river , or other body of water ; now, any border or edge.

definitions.definition: ( obsolete ) (The addition of quotations indicative of this usage is being sought:) The sea ; ocean ; water ; flood .

main_definition: ( obsolete ) (The addition of quotations indicative of this usage is being sought:) The sea ; ocean ; water ; flood .

definitions.definition: ( Australia , US ) Synonym of bream ( “ a freshwater fish from one of a number of genera ” ) ; specifically ( US ) , the redbreast sunfish ( Lepomis auritus ).

main_definition: ( Australia , US ) Synonym of bream ( “ a freshwater fish from one of a number of genera ” ) ; specifically ( US ) , the redbreast sunfish ( Lepomis auritus ).

definitions.definition: ( archaic ) The period when a sow ( “ female pig ” ) is ready to mate ; a heat , an oestrus , a rut ; also, an act of a boar ( “ male pig ” ) and sow mating.

main_definition: ( archaic ) The period when a sow ( “ female pig ” ) is ready to mate ; a heat , an oestrus , a rut ; also, an act of a boar ( “ male pig ” ) and sow mating.
( UK , slang , obsolete except dialectal ) An irascible , violent woman .
